definition: to fight over/to scramble for
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)
see 搶風|抢风[qiang1 feng1]
to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch

sentences.english: Super-angels will snap up stars that VCs miss.
sentences.chinese: 超级天使们将争抢风投们错过的明星。

sentences.english: For now, however, the billionaire yacht owners of the world will have to fight for parking spaces.
sentences.chinese: 然而眼下，全世界的亿万富豪船主们还是得争抢泊位。

sentences.english: A mid-air fight between two Arctic Terns battling it out for food.
sentences.chinese: 两只北极燕鸥在空中展开搏斗争抢食物。

sentences.english: The children like found strange treasure, all for the watch.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们像发现了奇宝，都争抢着看。

sentences.english: We began to struggle for the bag and a fight broke out.
sentences.chinese: 于是我们开始争抢那个包，一场斗殴发生了。

sentences.english: My seat is assigned, so there's no need to battle for position.
sentences.chinese: 我的位子是指定的，不再需要争抢座位。

sentences.english: When the bird got some food, the nine heads all came immediately to scramble for it.
sentences.chinese: 这只鸟一得到食物，九个头都过来争抢。

sentences.english: Women in the audience don't hesitate to jump and dive to get their hands on them.
sentences.chinese: 观众中的女性朋友们往往会毫不犹豫地跳起来争抢。

sentences.english: The children are often in conflict with each other over toys.
sentences.chinese: 这些孩子经常因为争抢玩具闹矛盾。

definition: to plunder/to pillage/to forcibly take
lit. you fight, I snatch (idiom); to compete fiercely offering no quarter/fierce rivalry/tug-of-war
see 搶風|抢风[qiang1 feng1]
to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch
to fight over/to contest/to vie over
looting
to compete/competition
to covet/to long for/to lust after
chaotic warfare/confused fighting/melee/to join in such fighting
to obtain by an effort/to strive to get sth
to seize (the strategic high ground)
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)
struggle
to match one's strength with/to compete/more competitive/to set oneself against sb/disobliging/to make a special effort
striving to be first and fearing to be last (idiom); outdoing one another
to dispute/to disagree/to argue opinionatedly/to wrangle
to fight at close quarters/hand-to-hand
